column2: The Jews led by [Root.Liege.GetTitledName] has fought a ten year war to take Jerusalem and the provinces immediately surrounding it from the Arabian Empire. The rise of the Jewish people in their native land has begun. Caliph Al-Mansur isn't happy with the loss of these provinces, but is willing to let the Jewish people alone. \n\nUpon the end of the war, [Root.Liege.GetFirstName] orders a temporary temple to be built on the temple mount. It is built according to the guidelines presented in the Tanakh and will be used as the main temple until the Third Temple can be rebuilt.
A lot of lives were lost...

Ever since the destruction of the Second Temple by the cruel Romans followed by the conquering of Jerusalem by both Christians and Muslims, we, the faithful Chosen People, have long awaited the HaMashiakh to retake what has been given to us by Yahweh. The Priests of Levi have confirmed your status as the HaMashiakh that has restored the United Kingdom of Israel.

You have decided to expel all Muslims from your realm. After your guards round the Muslims up, they are forced to depart in a large exodus for lands more friendly to their kind. They are allowed to keep many of their belongings, but you confiscate much of their gold.
It shall go to the Crown.

Muslims have been banned from your realm for some time, but strangely this seems to have had no effect on many of the malaises they were thought responsible for, such as famines and disease. By now most Muslims seem to have forgiven your offenses, and you have decided to welcome them back with open arms.
Mistakes were made. Let us not dwell on them.
All Muslims have been expelled from the realm.
All Muslims have been welcomed back into the realm.

You have decided to expel all Christians from your realm. After your guards round the Christians up, they are forced to depart in a large exodus for lands more friendly to their kind. They are allowed to keep many of their belongings, but you confiscate much of their gold.
It shall go to the Crown.

Christians have been banned from your realm for some time, but strangely this seems to have had no effect on many of the malaises they were thought responsible for, such as famines and disease. By now most Christians seem to have forgiven your offenses, and you have decided to welcome them back with open arms.
Mistakes were made. Let us not dwell on them.
All Christians have been expelled from the realm.
All Christians have been welcomed back into the realm.

There has not been a Kohen Gadol – a High Priest of Judaism – since the Romans destroyed the Second Temple roughly a thousand years ago. At long last, this position has been filled and the High Priesthood reconstituted.\n\nLike the Jewish priests of ancient times, the Kohen Gadol was traditionally required to be a descendant of Aaron, the older brother of Moses and from the Tribe of Levi. The Priesthood has moved into the living quarters and established itself at the Third Temple.

Purim is one of the holiest days for the Jewish people since it celebrates the deliverance of the Persian Jews from the evil Haman. The events are recorded in the Book of Esther and is recited during the celebrations.
Rosh Hashanah is the Jewish New Year with Jews celebrating what the next year may hold for them.

Yom Kippur is one of the most solemn holy days, since it is the Day of Atonement. Jews across the land pray for forgiveness of their sins and the sins they have done to others. After the restoration of the Third Temple, the original sacrificial system is fully restored. The sacrificial system was ordained by Yahweh in the days of yore when Moses led the Israelites.
I have become responsible for my own actions and sins. No longer will I hide behind my parents for my irresponsibilities or sins. My parents should be proud of who I have become.
My son is growing up fast. Today, he is now accountable for his own actions. I'm no longer held responsible for his sins and failures before the community and Yahweh.
I have become responsible for my own actions and sins. No longer will I hide behind my parents for my irresponsibilities or sins. My parents should be proud of who I have become.
My daughter is growing up fast. Today, she is now accountable for her own actions. I'm no longer held responsible for her sins and failures before the community and Yahweh.
It has come time for you to make a decision regarding the rebuilding of Jerusalem.
Make the city the Jewel of the Levant again!
After completing the prior rebuilding you can further improve the city to make it even more spectacular.
Strengthen all the walls of Jerusalem.

The Siqariqim have become too much of a hassal and have created too much havoc. They are uncontrollable, so you have ordered your loyal troops to hunt down every last member of their order. The battles raged all across your kingdom as they have been destroyed one holding at a time.
You have taken it upon yourself to rebuild the Siqariqim to their former glory. With the Siqariqim rebuilt they can spread fear and dread amongst the enemies of Israel.
The troops from the war of independence stand tall and ready. They await your command to defeat the enemies of Adonai.
